page.title: 11CHANGING TIMES
page.content: The Railway. The railway from Darlington to Barnard Castle ran through the area. It was opened in 1856 and was closed in November 1964. The track can still be seen although it is now joined to farmland. The two bridges which took the railway on a detour over the River Tees and then back reminding us that the Duke of Cleveland refused to let the railway run through the Selaby estate. Winston station, situated near Westholme, and about one mile from the village was once an extremely attractive station, well kept with old fashioned roses and laburnum bushes. It had a stationmaster, two poters and a signalman, Gordon Wilson who, with his wife brought up seven children in a two bedroomed cottage. Trains ran from Darlington to Penrith and
